CONJUGATES: screens (n. plural) | screens (v. 3rd person singular present) | screening (v. present participle) | screened (v. past tense, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old North French escren or Old French escrein (a protective cover), from Frankish *skerm or Old High German skirm 'shield, protective covering'. Related to modern German Schirm 'umbrella, shield'. The sense of a surface for projection appeared later.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A flat, vertical surface on which pictures or words are shown, for example, on a computer, television, or phone.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 电脑、电视、手机等显示图像或文字的平面。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The movie looks amazing on the big screen.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这部电影在大屏幕上看起来棒极了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To show a movie, television program, or information on a screen.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在屏幕上播放电影、电视节目或显示信息。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The cinema will screen the documentary next week.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 电影院下周将放映这部纪录片。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To examine or test people or things in order to determine suitability, identity, or to find specific characteristics, often for medical or security reasons.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 检查或测试人员或物品，以确定其适用性、身份或发现特定特征，常用于医疗或安全目的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: All new employees are screened for drug use.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 所有新员工都接受毒品检测。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A movable upright panel or partition, used to divide a room, conceal something, or provide shelter.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于分隔房间、遮挡物品或提供遮蔽的活动式竖直屏障。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They put up a screen to give the patient some privacy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们竖起了一个屏风，给病人一些隐私。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To conceal, protect, or shelter someone or something from view, danger, or unwanted attention.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 遮蔽、保护某人或某物，使其免受视线、危险或不必要的关注。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Tall trees screen the house from the road.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 高大的树木把房子遮蔽起来，使其不被路人看到。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A frame with mesh or gauze across it, used in a window or door to keep insects out.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 带有网格或纱布的框架，用于门窗以防止昆虫进入。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We need to fix the tear in the window screen.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们需要修补窗纱上的破洞。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The film or television industry generally, often referred to as 'the big screen' (cinema) or 'the small screen' (TV).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 电影或电视行业，常指“大银幕”（电影）或“小屏幕”（电视）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She dreams of seeing her name on the big screen.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她梦想着在大银幕上看到自己的名字。
